intro: Dactylicapnos gaoligongshanensis, commonly known as the Gaoligong Mountains dactylicapnos, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and humid environments, showcasing adaptations to its alpine habitat. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface, and it produces small, fragrant blossoms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
